relationship: Referral (you had a connection who connected you to the editor)

comment: "Terrible experience. Editor assigned story at 31p per word at 800 words. For two entire weeks after I submitted it, it sat un-edited. Suddenly one night she decided to edit it, without notice, and because I didn't respond to her questions within a 45-minute period (during which i was eating dinner), she cut the piece in half and published it, thus I was given only half the pay despite having done all the work. Terrible. I suggest making them promise in writing to pay you per words commissioned--not per words published--to avoid this happening again."

relationship: Referral (you had a connection who connected you to the editor)

comment: "Editor contacted me with the topic - 600-700 words. "

"Cold pitch to CiF. Rates not discussed in emails with editor. I received an email from their payments guy the next day, and a guardian contributor number followed the day after. 

132$ is the xe rate. I'm English and was paid about Â£90."

relationship: Submission/spec (piece was written prior and then submitted for publication)

comment:
"Editor sought out ideas, asked for more material and a rewrite. General contract specifies 310.68 pounds for 1000 words. Editor balked at paying for more than 900 words worth, although I ultimately got the money.
"
